post.title: The Crow
post.body:
**Film, 1994, USA, d. Alex Proyas.** Language: English.

*   [Rotten Tomatoes](https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/crow): Critics: 81%. Audience: 90%.
*   [IMDB](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0109506/): 7.6.
*   [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Crow_(1994_film%29)
*   Other links at bottom of article

Starring: Brandon Lee, Rochelle Davis, Ernie Hudson, Michael Wincott, Bai Ling.

> A vicious gang murders a young Goth couple and one year later the man rises from his grave to avenge his beloved.

![The.Crow.1994.BrRip.720p.x264.YIFY.webp (1280x688)](data/img/post_45_The.Crow.1994.BrRip.720p.x264.YIFY.webp)

Fuck me, it's already been **25 years** since _The Crow_ came out! And it shows: the movie feels _very_ 90s (thanks especially to the grungey soundtrack) and, for me, hasn't aged as well as some of other early 90s movies I've watched recently. The whole premise feels very much a goth teenage male wish-fulfillment fantasy. (The fianc√©e was also murdered, and raped too. And watched her fianc√© be murdered to boot. Why doesn't _she_ come back from the dead to exact vengeance?)

While I liked _The Crow_ a lot the first time I saw it, now it's just "OK". Good action; so-so story and characters (although an order of magnitude better than Lee's other films _Rapid Fire_ and _Showdown in Little Tokyo_, which work only for hardcore action fans).

And yes, this was the movie where Brandon Lee died; the scene in¬†which his character Eric Draven was shot and killed was the same scene where Brandon Lee was shot and killed in real life, when a piece of a fake bullet stuck in the gun from a previous take was pushed out by a blank charge and hit Lee in the abdomen. That's what happens when you try to save money by shooting in a non-union state, working people around the clock and then sending the (expensive) arms master home before shooting a weapons scene to avoid paying him overtime.

(Despite Draven's death happening at the beginning of the movie, it was one of the last bits to be filmed. As most of Lee's scenes had already been shot, _The Crow_ doesn't have the obvious & terrible fakery employed to hide the star's absence that was in [_Game of Death_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Game_of_Death), the film his father [Bruce](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bruce_Lee) was in the middle of when _he_ died.)

Who knows how far Brandon could have gone had he lived?

### Technical

I watched a 720p, high-resolution-small-file size encode from YTS / YIFY. I tend to prefer getting these types of encode because I can keep the smaller files for longer on my hard drive and and share more of them.

But, while their video quality is good enough most of the time, it can be problematic with certain kinds of scenes:

*   dark
*   night-time
*   rainy
*   foggy

And _The Crow_ is **all** dark, rainy, night-time scenes. I was getting [artifacts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Compression_artifact) all over the place for most of the film. (I wasn't able to capture them in my screenshots though; but it's really noticeable when the images are moving.) So I would recommend you go for some other version.

![The.Crow.1994.BrRip.720p.x264.YIFY.2.webp (1280x688)](data/img/post_45_The.Crow.1994.BrRip.720p.x264.YIFY.2.webp)

post.title: SKYND - "Elisa Lam"
post.body:
**Music video, 2019, directed by TallyHo!**

I saw [a post on ZeroM](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1RedkCkVaXuVXrqCMpoXQS29bwaqsuFdL/1GDzVsFoYamHqWcYBcuvVWFCAt3Y5yPNde/1557766235)e by Deliriumgoddess6 about this song so I decided to download & watch the video. Click link below screenshot.

![SKYND-Elisa.Lam-Official.Video.mkv](data/img/post_44_SKYND-Elisa.Lam-Official.Video.webp)

*   [ZeroUp Unlimited - SKYND-Elisa.Lam-Official.Video.mkv](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CiXRY9ATZSoZqBzwMfXEMsKtPRt2aQoF2/data/users/131Seivv6aH8vnohPmYPcPwPfZ1a5ubMMs/SKYND-Elisa.Lam-Official.Video.mkv)

For me it's got a kind of industrial/goth horror vibe to it.

It's about a mysterious, unsolved death:

*   [https://crypticrock.com/skynd-premiere-elisa-lam-video/](https://crypticrock.com/skynd-premiere-elisa-lam-video/)
*   [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Death_of_Elisa_Lam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Death_of_Elisa_Lam)

I don't know anything about the band/singer but the name is apparently that of [a Danish troll](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skynd).

post.body:

> Instructed to create a challenge which will allow him to explore the Dark Web, James seems entirely bereft of ideas.... until an online shopping error results in the delivery of 22 packets of button mushrooms.

A comedian makes a parody show investigating the Dark Web, obviously using the strip club from _The Wire_ as an analogy for the internet :)

You probably won't find it very informative if you're already here on ZeroNet (as it's just as much about parodying investigative journalism shows as it is about the Dark Web itself) but he does briefly interview a couple of experts about Tor and BitCoin.

From [James Veitch](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Veitch_(comedian%29), who's done things like [a TED Talk about leading on e-mail scammers](https://www.ted.com/talks/james_veitch_this_is_what_happens_when_you_reply_to_spam_email#t-29236).

(The mp3 image says "... with Harry Hill" but I think that's a reference to an earlier series distributed by the 'Flip' podcast.)

post.title: The Kill Hole
post.body:
**Film, 2012, USA, d. Mischa Webley.** Language: English.

*   [Rotten Tomatoes](https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/the_kill_hole): Critics: 17%. Audience: 31%.
*   [IMDB](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1727373/): 4.1.
*   [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chadwick_Boseman#Film) (It doesn't have its own Wikipedia page yet, so link goes to Chadwick Boseman's filmography)
*   Other links at bottom of article

**Starring: Chadwick Boseman, Tory Kittles, Billy Zane, Peter Greene.**

![The.Kill.Hole.2.webp (1298x720)](data/img/post_42_The.Kill.Hole.2.webp)

**Summary:** An Iraq war veteran back in the US is haunted, not by the war itself, but by an event that happened when he went back later as a mercenary. And now someone has started killing those connected to that event...

I chose this film as part of my checking out the free streaming service Tubi ([see this post](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1NEuAUKgUoY6fnXeXBaonjrDfNbfpQpdMp/?Post:39:Tubi+TV)). The previous film I saw (_Death Race 2000_, [see this post](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1NEuAUKgUoY6fnXeXBaonjrDfNbfpQpdMp/?Post:41:Death+Race+2000)) was an older film that was offered as a rather soft definition pan & scan 540p (probably converted from something made in the days of VHS tapes & 4:3 CRT televisions), so I went looking for something more recent to see if the video quality would be better.

In my market, Tubi's modern offerings seem to consist mostly of straight-to-video dross like _Bikini Model Academy_, so I had to dig a little to find something recent that looked interesting.

_The Kill Hole_ seems to tick many of the boxes of Tubi's offerings in my market:

*   I'd never heard of it
*   It features an actor before they were famous (Chadwick Boseman before _Get On Up_ and _Black Panther_)
*   It features actors _after_ they were famous (Billy Zane after his 90s heyday of _Titanic_, _The Phantom_ etc. Peter Greene after _The Mask_.)
*   Demographic "niche" (in this case, featuring African-American leads)
*   It bombed

Clearly, a lot of critics and moviegoers were not impressed with _The Kill Hole_. But I was: moving performances from the actors (and from the veterans in the support group, who are _not_ actors); beautiful cinematography and landscapes; a quality score by composer Jason Wells.

While there are a few moments of action, this is essentially a drama about the aftermath of war, and one I found involving.

**Technical**
I watched it on Tubi and was offered a variety of resolutions including maximum of 720p (which is what I tend to watch other ways too, e.g. Netflix in browser, Bittorrent downloads).

The video quality was _way_ better than Tubi's offering of _Death Race 2000_: high definition, widescreen, crisp and clean.

Furthermore, even though Tubi is supposedly supported by advertising, I wasn't bothered by a single advertisement in either movie: not before, during or after. I haven't even seen any ads on the website itself. And this is in bog-standard Chrome browser, with no ad-blocking extensions. I'm not sure how this is economically viable.

* * *

### Watch _The Kill Hole_

**Legitimate**
Note: legit streaming & download availability varies with geography & time.

post.title: Death Race 2000
post.body:
**Film, 1975, USA, d. Paul Bartel.** Language: English.

*   [Rotten Tomatoes](https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/death_race_2000): Critics: 83%. Audience: 63%.
*   [IMDB](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0072856/): 6.2.
*   [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Death_Race_2000)
*   Other links at bottom of article

From Rotten Tomatoes:

> Cult hero Paul Bartel directed this low-budget satire in which America's passion for cars, violence, and sporting events are finally brought together in one convenient package. In the not-so-distant future, the United States has become a totalitarian regime overseen by the charming but sinister Mr. President, who, in order to satisfy the masses' need for entertainment (and to quench their thirst for violence), has created a new national sport -- the Death Race.

It's from the infamous producer [Roger Corman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roger_Corman) whose low buget exploitation movies often acquired cult followings and gave a start in the business to many young filmmakers and actors.

_Death Race 2000_ is a movie I remember hearing about as a kid but never got to see , and I kept meaning to see it over the years but never got around to it. It eventually spawned [a remake/reboot franchise](https://theactionelite.com/looking-back-at-the-death-race-series/) and even inspired the [Carmageddon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carmageddon) series of video games.

After reading an article about it and seeing it was available on Tubi ([see previous post](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1NEuAUKgUoY6fnXeXBaonjrDfNbfpQpdMp/?Post:39)) I decided to give it a go, and I enjoyed it. Fun, jokey with some decent action (if a little sped up at times). Don't expect aything great, just entertainment. And Sylvester Stallone getting his arse kicked!

![Death.Race.2000.webp (1270x919)](data/img/post_41_Death.Race.2000.webp)

**Technical**
I saw it for free on Tubi and the version there was 4:3 pan & scan (IMDB say original ratio is 1.85 : 1) and maximum resolution was 540p. I'm sure there are better versions out there.

* * *

post.title: Tubi TV
post.body:
A blog post I read yesterday ([MakeUseOf - The Best Free Alternatives to Paid Streaming Services](https://www.makeuseof.com/tag/best-free-alternatives-paid-streaming-services/)) reminded me of a free alternative to Netflix, a streaming video-on-demand service called Tubi TV.

*   [https://tubitv.com/](https://tubitv.com/)
*   [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tubi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tubi)

I had bookmarked it a few years ago but never really got into it because:

*   I had so much stuff to watch downloaded from Bittorrent.
*   I had so much stuff to watch on Netflix.
*   So much of Tubi TV's content looks like absolute shit. :) (And of the few things that seemed interesting, most of them were also on Netflix.)

But that article reminded me of Tubi TV so I decided to take another look at it.

At almost the same time, I was reading another article ([The Action Elite - Looking back at the Death Race series](https://theactionelite.com/looking-back-at-the-death-race-series/)) which reminded me of the movie _Death Race 2000_, a notorious scif-fi action movie/satire that I've been meaning to see for... decades.

And then looking through Tubi TV's content, what do I see? _Death Race 2000_!

Thus I think to myself "No time like the present! Let's finally give both this service _and_ this movie a try."

So in the next few posts, I'll give my impressions of Tubi TV, _Death Race 2000_ and a few other things I watch on this free alternative to Netflix. (Hey, just because I'm on a darknet doesn't mean _everything_ has to be about copyright infringement.)

post.title: UK newspaper posts moved to their own blog
post.body:
In order to allow this blog here to focus more on other kinds of media I'm consuming and sharing, I've created a new blog especially for the "mirror" posts of the BBC News blog _The Papers_.

In a stroke of imaginative genius, it's called _The Papers_ :)

*   [**The Papers**](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Papers8S7fe6LEsa7BwVVywWVbMpUjgwx/)

It even has its own imaginative personalized vanity address!

*   1Papers8S7fe6LEsa7BwVVywWVbMpUjgwx

You can see the new blog's first post here:

*   [BBC News - The Papers - 2019.04.20 Saturday](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Papers8S7fe6LEsa7BwVVywWVbMpUjgwx/?Post:3:BBC+News+-+The+Papers+-+2019.04.20+Saturday)

### Changes

To those who've been following these newspaper posts, there are a few other changes too.

*   The file name made shorter and includes source name (e.g. _BBC.News-The.Papers-2019.04.20.Saturday.html_.)
*   The files are now "self-hosted": they are [optional files](http://127.0.0.1:43110/138R53t3ZW7KDfSfxVpWUsMXgwUnsDNXLP/?Page:optional-files) in the blog's own data folder, and no longer uploaded to third-party site ZeroUp Unlimited.
*   I'm no longer writing my own recap of the stories:

    *   because it's more work for me!
    *   because that cannot be automated (my eventual goal).
    *   because you're going to see the stories anyway when you view the article.
    *   to reduce space usage.

        So instead of a recap of stories, I'll just "mirror" the original title of the post on the BBC (e.g. _Grief and 'outrage' over Lyra McKee death_)

![_______________-_______.50pc.webp (640x360)](data/img/post_33________________-_______.50pc.webp)

*   [KopyKate - –í—Ä–µ–º—è –∏ –°—Ç–µ–∫–ª–æ - –¢—Ä–æ–ª–ª—å (Vremya i Steklo - Troll) 720p.webm](http://127.0.0.1:43110/18Pfr2oswXvD352BbJvo59gZ3GbdbipSzh/?Video=1555445549_131Seivv6aH8vnohPmYPcPwPfZ1a5ubMMs)

–í—Ä–µ–º—è –∏ –°—Ç–µ–∫–ª–æ ([Vremya i Steklo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vremya_i_Steklo)) are a Russian-language pop duo from the Ukraine. I can't remember how I originally came across their video for their song _–¢—Ä–æ–ª–ª—å_ (_Troll_) but I remember enjoying the song (sparse bass-heavy dance with singing and rapping) and the video as just great fun, even though I had no idea what they were saying. Apparently it's about a woman meeting a man in a nightclub and her positive and negative impressions of him , with the chorus roughly meaning "Don't troll me / don't cause me misery".

Here's a page with the Russian lyrics and English translation side-by-side. (There are also translations into French, Italian and Portuguese. You can even switch between Cyrllic and Roman alphabet for the Russian.)

Here's an interesting English language article about the group and the song, with a few phrases for those interested in learning Russian.

post.title: Serbuan Maut (The Raid)
post.body:
**Film, 2011, Indonesia, d. Gareth Huw Evans.** Language: Indonesian. English dub available.

*   [Rotten Tomatoes](https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/the_raid_redemption): Critics: 86%. Audience: 87%.
*   [IMDB](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1899353/): 7.6.
*   [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Raid_(2011_film%29)
*   Other links at bottom of article

_To clarify, I watched the 'Sony Pictures Classics' US release titled **The Raid: Redemption**, with English dub and new score._

![The.Raid.Redemption.2011.BRrip.x264.YIFY.webp (1280x720)](data/img/post_29_The.Raid.Redemption.2011.BRrip.x264.YIFY.webp)

_The Raid_ is an action movie from Indonesia about a police SWAT team taking on a crime lord's high-rise fortress, and getting trapped there in a battle to the death with no backup on the way.

Despite the plot devices/holes that mean the police can't call for backup (no radios, no mobile phones etc), I found _The Raid_ to be great entertainment, with a brisk pace, and fights with moves I hadn't seen a hundred times before, or even ever before, and without looking too "forced" or choreographed.

Being a _2000AD / Judge Dredd_ fan, I saw [_Dredd_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dredd) (2012) in the cinema, with a similar plot line (and even architecture), albeit with a sci-fi setting, but _The Raid_ didn't suffer in the comparison. I recommend both.

In short, it's a great action flick!

* * *

### Watch _The Raid_

**Legitimate**

*   [DuckDuckGo product search - Buy The Raid](https://duckduckgo.com/?q=buy+the+raid&t=vivaldi&ia=products)

*   While _The Raid_ is no longer available on Netflix, writer-director Evans's most recent film is: [_Apostle_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apostle_(film%29), a well-reviewed period horror.

post.title: Another Night at the Warp Core Cafe
post.body:
üé® **Illustration, Jeff Carlisle, USA, 2017-2018?**

![WarpCareCafe_final_art_forwebLR.50pc.webp (590x738)](data/img/post_21_WarpCareCafe_final_art_forwebLR.50pc.webp)

(Larger images further down the page)

_Another Night at the Warp Core Cafe_ is a science fiction illustration by [Jeff Carlisle](http://jeffcarlisle.com/).

It's like [Where's Wally?](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Where's_Wally%3F) but for nerds: it's a picture with hundreds of characters, objects and references from over a century of sci-fi. (Almost all from English-language film, television and comic books; although I did spot one, _maybe_ two, non-Anglophone sources). It's not great art, but it is great fan art, and a great game to play, trying to find every single character etc. Looking at it, I realized I recognized _way_ more things than is probably healthy ‚òª How much of my life have I spent watching sci-fi?!?

You can see the whole illustration as well as as closeups of certain sections here on his site: [http://jeffcarlisle.com/image/tid/68](http://jeffcarlisle.com/image/tid/68)

I'll also put up some images of it here, but unfortunately none of the images available online are very high resolution. (It's almost as if the artist is worried about it being subjected to unlimited online copyright infringement... üé∂ _klu9's media share_ whistles innocently üé∂ ) If anyone finds a higher resolution version, please let me know.

(Most images in WebP format. The full-size, highest-available-resolution images of the whole illustration are too big for a ZeroBlog and are hosted on ZeroUp Unlimited, so you will have to click on their "**Full size**" links first to see them at full size. The smaller images are hosted here.)

**How many characters, space ships, robots, weapons, toys, businesses, graffiti, and other objects & references can you find?**

Try to find as many as you can **before** looking up info or lists like this one here at stackexchange:

*   [Scifi.Stackexchange.com - Who are the (numerous) patrons of the Warp Core Cafe?](https://scifi.stackexchange.com/questions/205108/who-are-the-numerous-patrons-of-the-warp-core-cafe/205117) (which also the image and a locator grid to help find things)

Let us know how many you got in the comments!

Listing every single character and thing I recognized would be way too long, but I did make a list of all the shows, movies and comics I recognized someone or something from. I recognized **58 TV shows, movies and comics**. Plus one electronic toy from the 1970s! That I used to have! I'll put my list on NullPaste.

*   [NullPaste - TV shows, films and comics that I recognize something from in the illustration "Another Night at the Warp Core Cafe" - klu9](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz/?131Seivv6aH8vnohPmYPcPwPfZ1a5ubMMs_3)

There are a few more that I recognized but couldn't put a name to. (Like the little green guy in N12.) And once I looked at the Stackexchange list, I went "Oh of course!"

## **_Another Night at the Warp Core Cafe_**

### Whole Illustration

**Borderless**

![WarpCareCafe_final_art_forwebLR.stackexchange.jpg (609x900)](data/img/post_21_WarpCareCafe_final_art_forwebLR.stackexchange.jpg)

*   [Full size](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CiXRY9ATZSoZqBzwMfXEMsKtPRt2aQoF2/data/users/131Seivv6aH8vnohPmYPcPwPfZ1a5ubMMs/01_WarpCoreCafe_Whole_Borderless.jpg) (1217x1800 pixels)

post.title: Farscape
post.body:
üì∫ **TV, 1999-2004, Australia-USA.**

*   [IMDB](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0187636/): 8.3.
*   Wikipedia - [_Farscape_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Farscape) (seasons 1-4) & [_Farscape: The Peacekeeper Wars_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Farscape:_The_Peacekeeper_Wars) (the 2-part telemovie/miniseries that completes the series)

![farscape.slits.webp (1024x768)](data/img/post_18_farscape.slits.webp)

> "_My name is John Crichton, an astronaut. A radiation wave hit and I got shot through a wormhole. Now I'm lost in some distant part of the universe on a ship, a living ship, full of strange alien life forms. Help me. Listen, please. Is there anybody out there who can hear me? I'm being hunted by an insane military commander. I'm doing everything I can. I'm just looking for a way home._"

‚ô¶

> ‚Äú_everything you didn‚Äôt realize was missing from Star Trek_‚Äù

‚ô¶

> "_I dismissed [Farscape] early on because of... well, Muppets. But once I gave it a shot I was hooked. The journey‚Äôs of the characters was amazing. No one ended where they began. They grew and changed._"

‚ô¶

> "_Huh. You know, I hadn't thought about the parallels between Farscape and Guardians of the Galaxy before reading the linked articles, but now that it's pointed out, "Lone pop-culture-quoting human teams up with badass soldier alien love interest, big humorless warrior alien, sentient plant alien, and little con artist alien during a jail break" is a SURPRISINGLY SPECIFIC combination to apply to more than one thing._"

I'm a bit of a sci-fi junkie, watching pretty much every sci-fi movie and TV show I come across. An article that popped up in my newsfeed reminded of one of my favourite shows ever, sci-fi or otherwise: **_Farscape_**, created by [Rockne S. O'Bannon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rockne_S._O'Bannon) (who also created _Alien Nation_, _seaQuest_ and _Defiance_). Here it is:

*   [**io9 - A Look Back at Farscape: Aliens, Puppets, and Criminals on the Run**](https://io9.gizmodo.com/a-look-back-at-farscape-aliens-puppets-and-criminals-1833716459) (also [backed up here on ZeroNet](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CiXRY9ATZSoZqBzwMfXEMsKtPRt2aQoF2/data/users/131Seivv6aH8vnohPmYPcPwPfZ1a5ubMMs/io9-A.Look.Back.at.Farscape_-Aliens,Puppets,and.Criminals.on.the.Run.2019-04-04.html), in case the link dies or io9's parent company gets sued out of existence... [again](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bollea_v._Gawker))

_Farscape_ is the story of astronaut John Crichton, thrown through a wormhole across the galaxy and who ends up as a fugitive and sole human on a living ship with a bunch of wanted criminals. It's fun, exciting, moving, innovative and at times completely bonkers :) But read the io9 article, as it's a far better explanation of why you should watch the show, even now as it celebrates its 20th anniversary.

A quote from that article on _Farscape_'s legacy:

> The passion of Farscape‚Äôs fanbase has far from died out, even two decades after the premiere‚Äîand many Farscape fans are now behind the camera for TV and film. Actor Ben Browder (John Crichton) told io9 how often showrunners and filmmakers will cite Farscape as a source of inspiration to him. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve had conversations with [Bryan Fuller](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bryan_Fuller) {_American Gods, ST:Discovery_} and‚Ä¶Farscape. [Russell T. Davies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russell_T_Davies) {_Doctor Who_}‚Ä¶Farscape. When I met [James Gunn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Gunn), I introduced myself and he said ‚ÄòI know who you are.‚Äô And I said ‚ÄòYeah, I thought you did because I saw your movie, bro.‚Äô‚Äù Gunn credits Farscape as a major influence on Guardians of the Galaxy‚Äîproving that although it was short-lived, Farscape‚Äôs legacy endures.

You might have noticed a key word in the article title, a feature of the show that might put a lot of people off.

*   You: "But it has [muppets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Muppets) in it!"
*   Me:"Shut it! Those muppets convey more deep, adult emotion in a single episode of Farscape than the entire human casts of Voyager, Enterprise and SG-1 put together in their entire runs. **_You're_ the [muppet](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/muppet#Noun)!**"

OK, not a real conversation :) but _Farscape_ was often dismissed at a glance as a children's show because of its use of characters from the Jim Henson Workshop (which actually made for much more believable & expressive alien characters than turn-of-the century CGI or a bit of latex slapped on a human forehead _√† la_ Star Trek). Broadcasters who just assumed it was a kids' show got burned and had to change its scheduling to a later hour or make big cuts once they realized there was a lot of adult content and themes.

Although there are a few weak episodes in the first season (while the writers were still getting the hang of what they could do with a show that had so much freedom), _Farscape_ had some of the best story arcs and character development on television, still to this day.

It was broadcast in the same era as _The Sopranos_, which is often hailed as the beginning of the [new Golden Age of Television](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golden_Age_of_Television_(2000s‚Äìpresent%29). And **I'd argue that _Farscape_, with its character development, story arcs, and morally ambiguous protagonists dealing with the consequences of their choices over entire _seasons_ (not neatly wrapped up in 43 minutes), deserves a place right alongside _The Sopranos_ at the start of that golden age.** Sure, _Farscape_ has its occasional kooky episode (because unlike a lot of TV sci-fi, it would really try to take big chances with something truly different) but Season 3 (a.k.a. "the Season of Death") in particular is still among the most powerful storytelling I've experienced across any media.

An episode of Farscape was the very first thing I ever downloaded by Bittorrent (I had just moved to another country where it wasn't on TV). And 15 years later it was among the first things I watched on Netflix (not available there any more). And it was still fun, exciting, moving, saddening, and impressive after all those years, even after watching _Battlestar Galactica_, _The Wire_ and _Breaking Bad_. Give it a try, or check out the video below for an overview of Farscape.

<video width="640" height="360" controls="" flashstopped="true" id="dummyid48" preload="metadata"><source data-cke-saved-src="http://127.0.0.1:43110/16KrKKRNHUc8WnRNuV9PgNqZQ8zqGteT4p/merged-KxoVid/1C6HBuemduDRMUnQVqbbt68nyToN854Frd/data/users/131Seivv6aH8vnohPmYPcPwPfZ1a5ubMMs/why-1554392208007.mp4" src="http://127.0.0.1:43110/16KrKKRNHUc8WnRNuV9PgNqZQ8zqGteT4p/merged-KxoVid/1C6HBuemduDRMUnQVqbbt68nyToN854Frd/data/users/131Seivv6aH8vnohPmYPcPwPfZ1a5ubMMs/why-1554392208007.mp4"> Your browser does not support the video tag.</video>
[Kxovid - Why Farscape is awesome](http://127.0.0.1:43110/16KrKKRNHUc8WnRNuV9PgNqZQ8zqGteT4p/?/channel/131Seivv6aH8vnohPmYPcPwPfZ1a5ubMMs/1554391923913/v/1554392216355) (You might need to download "Vlogs" from [the Kxovid Categories page](http://127.0.0.1:43110/kxovid.bit/?/categories) in order to see it.)

* * *

## _Farscape_ Links

*   [Farscape.com](https://web.archive.org/web/20020722113342/http://www.farscape.com/) (as preserved by the Internet Archive)
*   [Syfy.com - articles tagged "Farscape"](https://www.syfy.com/tags/farscape)
*   [Farscape Encyclopedia Project](https://farscape.fandom.com/wiki/Farscape_Encyclopedia_Project:Main_Page) - wiki
*   [Reddit - r/farscape](https://www.reddit.com/r/farscape/)
*   [Farscape Continues](https://farscapecontinues.space/) - blog, info, forum
*   [Wikiquote - Farscape](https://en.wikiquote.org/wiki/Farscape)
*   [Television without Pity - Farscape](http://www.brilliantbutcancelled.com/show/farscape/) - extensive recaps (obviously, spoilers) of each episode, written at time of original broadcast.
*   [Reddit - Gallery of Save Farscape fan art by Ratscape](https://www.reddit.com/r/farscape/comments/b3szr9/ratscapes_save_farscape_art/) - some wonderful images.

![farscape.wanted.aeryn.gif (555x732)](data/img/post_18_farscape.wanted.aeryn.gif)

### Rewatch articles & podcasts

Where the author/forum rewatches the series and writes an article on each episode as they go along; contain spoilers. When I saw Farscape again on Netflix, I'd go devour the relevant Tor.com rewatch article after each episode.

*   [Farscape Rewatch on Tor.com](https://www.tor.com/series/farscape-rewatch-on-torcom/) by Scott K. Andrews, author of _The Farscape Companion_ and writer of episodes for several sci-fi shows. Providing insight both as a fan and as an industry insider.
*   [AV Club - Farscape rewatch](https://www.avclub.com/c/tv-review/farscape)
*   [Metafilter - FanFare - Farscape](https://fanfare.metafilter.com/show/farscape/2)
*   [The Frellcast](http://frellcast.tumblr.com/) - podcast by a group of fans analyzing each episode. Also on [Soundcloud](https://soundcloud.com/frellcast#_=_)

### Youtube Videos

*   [Youtube - all results for _Farscape_](https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=farscape)
*   [YouTube - SyFy 20th Anniversary Special 2012 - FarScape](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J8w34PSrVs0) (made for the 20th anniversary of SciFi channel, not of Farscape. Contains spoilers)
*   [Why Farscape is awesome](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0S4dbCDHvZQ) (the Youtube source for the video I've uploaded to Kxovid)
*   [Farscape Then and Now 2019 - How They've Changed](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=34pgGmNHMqU) - photos comparing the cast at the time of the show and now. Warning: Crappy song at beginning and end of video.

## Watch _Farscape_

Note: Some sites/people treat the final two-parter "Farscape: Peacekeeper Wars" as a completely separate thing from the rest of the series, some as (an unofficial) Season 5, some as the last two episodes of Season 4\. That might affect finding it.

### Legitimate

*   [DuckDuckGo - Buy Farscape](https://duckduckgo.com/?q=buy+farscape&t=ffnt&ia=products) (box sets are available at reasonable prices)
*   _Farscape_'s streaming/download availability moves around a lot. I saw it when it was on Netflix, and it's also been on Hulu and Google Play. At time of writing it's apparently available on Amazon Prime (which treats Peacekeeper Wars as part of Season 4, in case you have trouble finding it).

### Torrents

I don't have torrents from 18 years ago :) so I'll just give some search result pages here.

*   [Torrentz2.eu - _Farscape_](https://torrentz2.eu/search?f=farscape) & [Torrentz2.eu - _Farscape BDrip_](https://torrentz2.eu/search?f=farscape+bdrip) (it looks like someone has released some BluRay rips in the last few days, perhaps for the 20th anniversary)
*   [The Pirate Bay - _Farscape_](https://thepiratebay.org/search/farscape/0/99/0)

In case those sites die, here's the magnet for [a popular, comprehensive torrent on The Pirate Bay](https://thepiratebay.org/torrent/11563330/Farscape.1999-2003._amp_.The.Peacekeeper.Wars.2004_Complete_Set) from a VIP uploader (I haven't checked it myself):

*   Magnet: [Farscape - complete set](magnet:?xt=urn:btih:71e229270d4d7f1b11abed5af94d4439369f4c0c&dn=Farscape.1999-2003.%26amp%3B.The.Peacekeeper.Wars.2004+Complete+Set&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.leechers-paradise.org%3A6969&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.openbittorrent.com%3A80&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fopen.demonii.com%3A1337&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.coppersurfer.tk%3A6969&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fexodus.desync.com%3A6969). Farscape seasons 1-4, Peacekeeper Wars miniseries, DVD/BD extras, comic books, even the PC game!

### ZeroNet

I couldn't find any results for Farscape anywhere on ZeroNet: not episodes hosted on ZeroNet, not torrents, not even articles or posts. Not a single mention :(

post.title: Wild Things
post.body:
üé¨ **Film, 1998, USA, d. John McNaughton.** Language: English.

*   [Rotten Tomatoes](https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/wild_things): Critics: 64%. Audience: 53%.
*   [IMDB](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0120890/): 6.5.
*   [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wild_Things_(film%29)
*   Other links at bottom of article

![Screenshot.Wild.Things.1998.720p.BluRay.x264.YIFY.2.jpg (1280x528)](data/img/post_16_Screenshot.Wild.Things.1998.720p.BluRay.x264.YIFY.2.jpg)‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã

_Wild Things_ is an erotic thriller I've seen dozens of times over the two decades since its release. Only I've never watched it till now: I've just seen the screenshots and [animated GIFs of Denise Richards and Neve Campbell snogging in the pool](https://gifer.com/en/vnw), or the threesome they have with Matt Dillon, posted on the internet over and over again.

I think the consensus is that the movie is cheesy trash but with a significant portion saying it's **great**, interesting, fresh, cheesy trash, with a great ensemble cast (Dillon, Campbell, Kevin Bacon, Richards, and the revered Bill Murray as a sleazy lawyer) doing great work.

I think a year ago I read some article (which I can't find) celebrating its twentieth anniversary and making a case for its greatness so I finally decided to see where the GIFs came from :)

And I enjoyed it. Not a movie I'd send into space so that aliens can judge our species by, but fun and maintaining suspense through to the end. And make sure you _do_ watch it to the end: important things happen even after the end credits have started rolling.

On a side note, being from 1998, it features [a completely unironic use of Smash Mouth](https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/all-star).

**Technical note**: there have been different edits of the film, with later releases having a few short scenes that explain a bit more about the characters. The original release is 1 hour 48 minutes, but the version I saw is 1 hour 55 minutes.

* * *

### Watch _Wild Things_

**Legitimate**

post.title: Monga / ËâãËà∫
post.body:
a.k.a. **_Bang-kah_**
**‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãFilm, 2010, Republic of China, d. Ni«î Ch√©ngz√©** (a.k.a. Doze Niu). Languages: Hokkienese, Mandarin.

*   [Rotten Tomatoes](https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/bang_kah): Critics: n/a. Audience: 76%.
*   [IMDB](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1604900/): 6.9.
*   [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monga_(film%29)
*   Other links at bottom of article

![Monga.2010.720p.BRrip.Sujaidr.jpg (1280x544)](data/img/post_9_Monga.2010.720p.BRrip.Sujaidr.jpg)

_Monga: the young princes of the Temple Front gang_

The [district of Monga](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wanhua_District) (its name from an indigenous Taiwanese language; also known as ËâãËà∫ B√°ng-kah in Hokkienese and W√†nhu√° in Mandarin) is Taipei's oldest neighbourhood, replete with temples, a [night market](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Night_market) and, in the era this film is set, old-school gangs and a massive red light district. Block bosses control just a few streets and preserve the old ways.

In 1984, teenager ËöäÂ≠ê Wenzi ("Mosquito") moves to Monga. After a lifetime of being bullied, he finally finds a group who'll accept him: a gang formally led by ÂøóÈæç ("Dragon"), the teenage son of block boss Geta (so nicknamed for the Japanese clogs he wears and sometimes uses in fights) but driven by ÂíåÂ∞ö ("Monk"). The 5 boys become "sworn brothers" and the youth wing of the Temple Front gang, who control the few blocks in front of the night market's big temple, and are historic enemies of the Back Alley gang, who control the streets behind the temple.

Wenzi and his brothers grow closer, but it can't be all camaraderie and good times. Over the next few years, consequences, resentment and ambition all come to a head in a devastating denouement. Especially as the old-school block bosses, concerned with their traditions of being local godfathers protecting their own small patches of turf, struggle to evolve in the face of large-scale professional organized crime encroaching on their little world.

While it gets a little melodramatic at times, _Monga_ generally does a very good job telling a familiar story in a compelling way. And it was given many awards and honours, e.g. it was Taiwan's entry for Best Foreign Language Film for the 2010 Oscars (although it didn't make the shortlist). It even beat Hollywood behemoth Avatar at the box office on its day of release.

And for me personally, it was interesting to see this dark underbelly of Taipei, going on just a few years before I lived there (and next to a night market, too!)

post.title: UK Newspapers Front Pages - Sunday 24th March 2019
post.body:
### **Stories:** Brexit defeat "cabinet coup" rumours - "Remain" march - Speedboat killer to return - Fall of ISIS "caliphate" - Spice Girls night in bed together

*   ‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã[UK.Newspapers.Front.Pages-2019.03.24.Sunday-BBC.News.(for.desktop).mhtml](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CiXRY9ATZSoZqBzwMfXEMsKtPRt2aQoF2/data/users/131Seivv6aH8vnohPmYPcPwPfZ1a5ubMMs/UK.Newspapers.Front.Pages-2019.03.24.Sunday-BBC.News.(for.desktop%29.mhtml) (link fixed now)

Saved in [.mhtml format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MHTML) (all-in-one webpage inc. images).

![BBC.The.Papers.2019.03.24.png (988x996)](data/img/post_4_BBC.The.Papers.2019.03.24.png)

Every day, the BBC News blog [The Papers](https://www.bbc.com/news/blogs/the_papers) provides:

> A detailed round-up of the main stories covered in the UK‚Äôs national newspapers ‚Äì including a look at the front pages and expert reviews on the BBC News Channel.

[UK newspapers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_newspapers_in_the_United_Kingdom) included: left, right, centre, and just pure fish wrap.

There are slight variations from day to day in exactly which newspapers are shown, but the biggies are almost always there. The Times, The Guardian, The Daily Telegraph, Daily Mirror, Daily Mail, Daily Express, Financial Times, i, Daily Star. Plus their weekend/Sunday equivalents. Occasional: The Independent, Metro, City AM, others.

Also sometimes the blog post will mention and link to stories not shown on the front page, or even stories from papers whose front page is not shown that day.

I find it a nice, quick way to get an overview of the wide variety of what's being said by all the different papers and not stay in an echo chamber, even if I often find myself grinding my teeth when I see The Grauniad and the Mirror's front pages (and often just shaking my head when I see the Express's or the Mail's).

On the day of release, it includes large captures of the actual front pages of the papers. However (probably for copyright/licensing reasons), those front pages disappear after one day, leaving just the text review of the papers' stories.

So here I have saved the post for Sunday the 24th of March, 2019, in .mhtml format. (The version saved is suitable for viewing on desktop computers.) This captures everything all into one file, so even when the BBC takes down the images of the front pages, you can still view them in the .mhtml file. (If you save the webpage as ".html only", the file is smaller but when you try to view the page it will try call in resources like images from their original clearnet sources, and they'll be gone.) Set your file manager / operating system to open .mhtml files in your preferred browser.

**EDIT: I'm continuing to save these blog posts on ZeroNet but they are now saved in all-in-one _.html_ (not .mhtml) using the¬†[SingleFile](https://github.com/gildas-lormeau/SingleFile) browser extension.**

Adjust the width of your browser window until the front page images are displayed clearly. (Image width: 976 pixels.)

I'd really like to be able to script saving The Papers blog post on the day of release and publishing it on ZeroNet. But it's a "responsive design" page, which particularly affects the size and resolution of the images of the front pages: I have to adjust the browser window to just the right width and give time for each newspaper's front page to be displayed in the browser window before it finally loads the highest resolution version. I don't know if a script could take care of that.

post.title: Monty Python's The Meaning of Life
post.body:
**Film, 1983, UK, d. Terry Jones**

*   [Rotten Tomatoes](https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/monty_pythons_the_meaning_of_life): Critics: 85%. Audience: 83%.
*   [IMDB](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0085959/): 7.6.
*   [Wikipedia- Monty Python's The Meaning of Life](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monty_Python's_The_Meaning_of_Life)
*   Other links at bottom of article

![Screenshot.The.Meaning.of.Life.jpg (1280x720)](data/img/post_3_Screenshot.The.Meaning.of.Life.jpg)

_Oh, **do** pay attention, boy!_

The [Monty Python team](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monty_Python) return to a sketch comedy format and proceed to mock sex, religion, war, school, healthcare, class, imperialism, bureaucracy, greed, aging, death - in short: life.

This was the last thing the Pythons did (at least with all of them) but probably the first I saw. I was either too young or not born yet for their earlier stuff which I didn't catch till much later, what with only 3-4 TV channels in the UK at the time and home media like VHS and Betamax (guess which we had at first) in its infancy. In fact, the main home media for TV show fans back in those days was... audio albums. "Miss the show? Buy the LP!" (And the Monty Python albums are [available on ZeroTorrent](http://127.0.0.1:43110/ZeroTorrent.bit/?Topic:16_131Seivv6aH8vnohPmYPcPwPfZ1a5ubMMs/Monty+Python+album+collection).)

While some consider _The Meaning of Life_ less worthy than _Life of Brian_ and _The Holy Grail_, I still enjoyed it immensely last night on Netflix and was surprised just how much of it I still remembered, given that I haven't seen it in about 30 years!

### Accolades

*   > disgusting, ridiculous, tactless, but above all, amusing.
    > _Variety_

*   Won the Grand Prix at the Cannes Film Festival.

*   Banned in Ireland

![every.sperm.jpg (500x286)](data/img/post_3_every.sperm.jpg)

At the time, the "Short Feature Presentation" [_The Crimson Permanent Assurance_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Crimson_Permanent_Assurance) was treated as a technically-separate short film shown ahead of _The Meaning of Life_, but it's now generally regarded (and included) as the first part of _The Meaning of Life_. (If it's listed as 1hr30mins, that's without _The Crimson Permanent Assurance_. If it's listed as 1hr48mins, then it's included.)

*   First appearance on film of [Matt Frewer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matt_Frewer) (_Max Headroom, Orphan Black, Eureka_ and a million other things).

post.title: The Incident (1967)
post.body:
**Film, 1967, USA, d. Larry Peerce**

*   [RottenTomatoes](https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/the_incident_1967): Critics: 83%. Audience: 87%
*   [IMDB](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0061814/): 7.7 (but of people who bothered to write a review, most give it 9 or 10)
*   [Wikipedia - The Incident (1967 film)]([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Incident_(1967_film%29](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Incident_(1967_film%29)
*   Other links (Magnet etc) at bottom of article.

![Screenshot-The.Incident.1967.720p.BluRay.x264-_YTS.AM_-2.jpg (1280x682)](data/img/post_2_Screenshot-The.Incident.1967.720p.BluRay.x264-_YTS.AM_-2.jpg)

_The Incident: Artie (Martin Sheen) and Joe (Tony Musante) waiting for someone to mug._

Sometimes I add a movie to my Netflix list or download it from BitTorrent and forget about it for a while, sometimes long enough to forget why I went for it, and even what it's about. I can't for the life of me remember why I downloaded _The Incident_ but I'm glad I did.

(When I noticed it sitting on my hard drive, I thought _maybe_ it was a psychological sci-fi film...? It ain't.)

_The Incident_ is a powerful neo-noir drama/thriller set on one Sunday night/Monday morning in New York City. We see snapshots of various people's lives, with only one thing in common: they will all end up on the same subway car, and that will mean a night they will never forget, as a couple of young hoodlums out for trouble and a good time pick on (and pick apart) every other passenger there.

From Rotten Tomatoes:

> After mugging a helpless old man, switchblade-wielding punks Martin Sheen and Tony Musante take over a subway car, terrorizing its occupants. In Stagecoach fashion, all the best and worst qualities of the passengers are brought to the surface by the presence of danger.

The premise may seem unlikely to some nowadays, but coming only a few years after [the infamous Kitty Genovese murder](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Murder_of_Kitty_Genovese), when an entire New York City block looked away as a young woman was slowly butchered on the street (with no one intervening, no one even calling the police), _The Incident_ captures a place and a time where no one would stick their neck out, no one would look trouble in the eye. And yet it still speaks about human tendencies today.

I watched this only a few nights after [_Speed_](http://127.0.0.1:43110/ZeroTorrent.bit/?Topic:43_131Seivv6aH8vnohPmYPcPwPfZ1a5ubMMs/Speed+1994+1080p+BrRip+x264+BOKUTOX+YIFY) (1994, USA, d. Jan De Bont), another film centred on a group of terrorized people trapped on public transport. And while I had a great time watching _Speed_, _The Incident_ proves there's something even more disturbing than a fuckton of C4 strapped under your arse: _people_. And not just the bad people, but the "normal", even the "good" people (who it turns out ain't so great after all). Because the last time I checked, people are all around us, and C4... not so much.

The film features a great ensemble cast, led by Tony Musante (whose name I didn't recognize but whose face I did) and Martin Sheen (in his first ever film role) as the hoodlums, with Beau Bridges (_The Fabulous Baker Boys_), Brock Peters (_To Kill a Mockingbird_, _Start Trek: DS9_), Ed McMahon (!)(I never knew he did anything other than laugh at Johnny Carson's jokes on _The Tonight Show_), Donna Mills (_Knot's Landing_), Victor Arnold (_Shaft_), Ruby Dee (_Do the Right Thing_, _American Gangster_) and others you might recognize from their work as character actors or even leads over the years.

**klu9's verdict: A great movie that's hard (& gripping) to watch.**

Technically, the cinematography isn't anything to write home about, but that isn't surprising given that it was an independent movie that lost funding part-way through (and was rescued by 20th Century Fox) and that the NYC Transit Authority didn't approve of "terror on the subway" movies, so the filmmakers had to get background & exterior shots etc by sneaking aboard cameras in shopping bags!

And that's part of why I'd never heard of _The Incident_: its financial troubles, coupled with one negative pre-release review from _The New York Times_, led Fox to bury its release in an unfavourable slot with little marketing, and so it basically went unnoticed in the US. It's never even been released on home video there since a Laser Disc (!) in 1990! But apparently it did better in Europe, where it has recently got [a well-reviewed (but _very_ limited edition) BluRay release](https://www.dvdtalk.com/reviews/72837/incident-limited-edition-the/).

* * *

post.title: My new blog about sharing media
post.body:
I've decided to create a blog for sharing media and perhaps a few thoughts about it.

Why?

*   I already share media on ZeroTorrent.bit, but:

*   *   some media I want to share is not on BitTorrent.
*   *   I have space issues on ZeroTorrent. It always gives me "Include too large [sic]" errors. I'm never sure if my upload has worked.
*   I already share on [ZeroMe](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Profile/12h51ug6CcntU2aiBjhP8Ns2e5VypbWWtv/131Seivv6aH8vnohPmYPcPwPfZ1a5ubMMs/klu9@zeroid.bit), but I'd prefer to keep my posts there short. Here I can be as long winded as I like :P

*   I already have [my other blog](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Ctjcvfovq6d1JWEGvM1JovCym4H6Es33L/), but I'd like one purely about media sharing, to leave that blog for other things.

In this blog, I'll share media (probably mainly movies, but from time to time other things too), with links to get the media (e.g. legit purchase, BitTorrent magnets, ZeroNet sources like IFS & KopyKate etc) and maybe my comments about it too. Enjoy!
